creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: glowing lanterns hanging under the eaves of a multi-storied temple; people gathered around the balcony of the temple; silhouettes of trees in background
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和八年作　奈良の夕 {jizuri, Shōwa hachinen saku, Nara no yūbe} | bottom, in gray: Evening in Nara | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled series known as Kansai District
title: Evening in Nara
